Package serverside.gamehandler

Class GameHandlerMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverside.gamehandler.GameHandlerMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, GameHandler
    public class GameHandlerMethod
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameHandler, java.lang.Runnable
    The game handler responsible for handling the messages sent by the client and sending messages to the client when in a game of Pentago. Whenever a client gets in a game, a new GameHandler object is created for the client. Before the game has started and after the game has ended the ClientHandler handles the client's messages.

      This method is used to access the condition toDone which indicates if the client has just finished a game.

      This method is used to remove the client from a game.

      • run

        public void run()
        Since this class is a runnable it has a run method which is executed everytime a new Thread of this class is started. This method handles the messages sent by the client and sends messages to the client accordingly. It also manipulates various variables to ensure thread-safety and a smooth gaming experience for the client while in game.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
